thread.title: Marietta's Ohio River Sternwheel Festival starts Friday on levee
thread.title_full: Marietta's Ohio River Sternwheel Festival starts Friday on levee

author: Staff Reports
title: Marietta's Ohio River Sternwheel Festival starts Friday on levee
text:
Marietta’s Ohio River Sternwheel Festival starts Friday on levee
MARIETTA — The 49th Annual Ohio River Sternwheel Festival will be held this coming weekend Friday, Sept. 5 – Sunday, Sept. 7 along the Ohio River in Marietta.
The festival that began in 1976 as a project between Harry Robinson, Capt. Gene Finch and Capt. Bob Limle has grown over the years and, according to the organizing committee, has attracted over 100,000 people to the Marietta riverside in the past 49 years.
The event includes a line up of sternwheel boats set up along the riverfront which people can view as well as live entertainment, food and more. Visitors can also visit many of the shops in downtown Marietta throughout the weekend.
Schedule of Events
Friday, Sept. 5
* 6 p.m.: Opening Ceremonies
* 7 p.m.: Steve & Beverly Pottmeyer
* 8 p.m.: Division Street
* 9:30 p.m.: Ian Harrison
Saturday, Sept. 6
* 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.: Art Stroll
* 12 p.m.: Marietta High School Wall of Sound
* 1 p.m.: Marietta High School Choir – Vocal Point
* 2 p.m.: The Stone Quillen Band
* 3 p.m.: Gypsy River Band
* 4 p.m.: 3M Acoustic Trio
* 5 p.m.: Cryin Out Loud Band
* 6 p.m.: Jake Binegar
* 7 p.m.: Queen’s Coronation
* 7:30 p.m.: Evie Schaffer
* 8:15 p.m.: Jake Binegar
* 9 p.m.: Journey From the Heart
* 9:30 p.m.: Harry J. Robinson Fireworks
* 10 p.m.: Journey From the Heart
Sunday, Sept. 7
* 8:30 a.m.: Sunrise Service
* 9:30 a.m.: Harry and Cathy Beall Christian Music
* 10 a.m.: Charlie Brewer
* 10 a.m. to 3 p.m.: Car Show (Second Street)
* 11 a.m.: Cold Shot
* 12 p.m.: Rick K. Road Trip
* 1 p.m.: Captain James E. Sands Memorial Boat Races
* 2 p.m.: Rick K. Road Trip
* 2:30 p.m.: Clint Carsey and the Tracklayers
